title: KDP Rocket Tutorial: Introduction and Review

tactics.name: Book Idea Search
tactics.description: Identify profitable niches using Amazon and Google search data to assess market demand and competition
steps: Analyze term data including competitors, earnings, and search volume
caveats: Amazon suggested searches may be overly competitive
source_quotes: KDP Rocket will get to work finding other book idea suggestions

tactics.name: Competitor Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate top-ranking books to identify strengths/weaknesses and uncover market opportunities
steps: Use competitor analysis button to pull top Amazon results
Identify gaps to differentiate your book
caveats: Results vary based on Amazon's personalization algorithms
source_quotes: KDP Rocket gives you the basic book information for each

heuristics.name: Competitive Advantage
heuristics.condition: If average earnings are high but competitor score is low, then prioritize this term
source_quotes: KDP Rocket figures out exactly how hard it would be to compete

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Heuristic
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200 then boost
source_quotes: Fire the mouse over the particular information...benefits that that number set provides

claims.statement: KDP Rocket provides competitor scores to quantify market difficulty
source_quotes: KDP Rocket creates a competition score from 1 to 99

claims.statement: KDP Rocket provides support and bug reporting features
source_quotes: Click our support button...send us a message

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with unmet needs and unique constraints for niche targeting
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates underserved markets with lower competition and higher pricing potential
source_quotes: You might be able to find a brand new topic but highly searched for book idea
